intro: Atractylis ovata f. ternata, commonly known as the ternate atractylis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its foliage is aromatic and often has a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
